thread.title_full: Arsenal legend Jens Lehmann aims dig at Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri

author: markbrus88
title: Arsenal legend Jens Lehmann aims dig at Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri
text:
Massimiliano Allegri has not impressed Jens Lehmann (Picture: Getty) Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann has aimed a dig at Juventus manager Massimiliano Allegri as he continues to be linked with replacing Arsene Wenger .
Brandt, Weigl and the Germany players PL bosses will be watching v England The Italian tactician has emerged as a leading candidate to take over at the Emirates Stadium if Wenger does end up moving on at the end of this season, but Lehmann is thoroughly unconvinced he’s the right man for the job.
Despite his great success with both Juve and previous club AC Milan, Allegri’s style of football has not impressed Lehmann, who is remaining loyal to Wenger despite the Gunners’ poor recent form.
Jens Lehmann has slammed Arsenal fans calling for Arsene Wenger’s head (Picture: Getty) ‘Bring Allegri in and we will win everything? Who is Allegri, with all due respect? He is in Italy. Will somebody like him bring success?’ Lehmann told The Sun .
‘When you look at the type of football he is playing, it doesn’t really fit Arsenal.’
Borussia Dortmund’s Thomas Tuchel and AS Monaco boss Leonardo Jardim have also been strongly linked with the Arsenal job, though latest reports suggest Wenger is set to stay after signing a new two-year contract .
Next Arsenal manager odds (Coral) Massimiliano Allegri – 4/1 Thomas Tuchel – 6/1
Eddie Howe – 13/2
Leonardo Jardim, Diego Simeone – 8/1
Rafael Benitez – 9/1 More: Football Arsenal handed major blow as key star is ruled out for FOUR WEEKS

The Frenchman’s current deal is due to expire at the end of this season and recent fan protests have called for him to end his long association with the north London giants.
